intro: Sesamum rostratum, commonly known as the narrowleaf sesame, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Pedaliaceae family and is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and distinctive, showy yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain small, brown seeds used for various traditional purposes. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
